The course was well organized to facilitate student learning
I received clear feedback that improved my learning

Comments_List: OM chem!

We covered a ton of material on different mechanisms, applications, and analysis of organometallics. It was interesting to hear thoughts Bob had on future fields and his insight on some of these reactions when they originated.
learned some basics to a completely new area of chemistry for me
A greater understanding of fundamental organometallic reaction mechanisms and insight into the complex nature of metal-carbon bonds.
I gained great insight into the field of organometallic Chemistry and its history.
Many insights into how and why some metal carbon bonds form and others do not.  Many discussions about industrial processes and their utility as well.

-Applications of OM chemistry in various fields 
-Dr. Crabtree touched on history of certain reactions/catalysts, which I thought was very insightful. 
-He also taught us a lot of modern/relevant literature (including research from our own dept.) which was interesting
Fundamentals of coordination and organometallic chemistry
Organometallic chemistry
I learned more about how to apply inorganic concepts in an organic reaction setting. i
I have developed a deeper understanding of the transition metals and their applications in organic chemistry.
I learned about the different organometallic reactions that are available.
All the powerpoints are online, but class would be improved if the instructor did not just read off them for the entire class.
Strengths: Bob Crabtree Weaknesses: Lecture format

It would be nice to have homework or more practice problems.  The questions in the book were many times obscure and did not give detailed answers to help us understand.  We also covered material very quickly.
have more opportunities to apply material, like optional problem sets not in the book
you're learning organometallics from Bob Crabtree, which is awesome. but he moves through the course material so so fast, it was hard to learn sometimes.
A major strength of this course is the course textbook which was written by the professor. Weakness? Maybe more practice problems.
Going through the course material too quickly.
Good material. Could be more interactive. Homeworks might help. Also, maybe not all PowerPoint.

Professor Crabtree is a great resource for knowledge on this subject, but there were very few opportunities in class to do practice problems so he could identify the topics we were struggling to comprehend.

-Instructor is incredibly enthusiastic and knowledgeable
-textbook is excellent reference
-course could be improved by fewer lecture slides and progression through material at a slower pace
It'll be better if more synthetic use of the organometallic chemistry could be included
The course material is very well organized in the lecture slides. The practice problems given in the textbook would be more helpful if illustrated answers are given.
It would be better if Professor Crabtree could draw on board more and explain things in more detail.
Professor is very nice but his lectures are not helpful. Also textbook is not helpful...
I liked how the material was presented by chapter. It made it easy to follow along in the textbook.

The course is progressing too fast to catch up with all the material.
On the contrary, the information is extremely useful not only for inorganic but also for organic chemistry students.
Yes, it is an essential class for students continuing on in chemistry.
yes
yes, but I would warn them that the class moves really quickly and the book doesn't always help. Still an interesting class.
Yes.
Yes, I thought the assessments accurately depicted the course material.
Yes
I would recommend this course to anyone interested in organometallic chemistry.  It may not be perfect, but it is very informative.
Yes
Taking a course with Bob was a pleasure and a privilege
Yes. You'll gain some mechanistic insight into organometallic chemistry
yes
YES.
Only if you like organic chem

I would recommend the course just because learning from Bob is amazing, as he wrote the book on this topic. In terms of how well the course was taught, the slides were way too fast, so I would warn them of that.
I would totally recommend the course!!!!
